descript.abstract: The Canadian Climate Change Scenarios Network (CCCSN is a partner interface for distributing climate change scenarios and adaptation research. Its goals are to: (1) support climate change impact and adaptation research in Canada and other countries; (2) support stakeholders requiring scenario information for decision making and policy development; (3) provide access to the work of AIRS, an Environment Canada research group under the auspices of the Atmospheric Science and Technology Directorate; and (4) provide access to Canadian research on the development of scenarios and adaptation research. CCCSN provides access various databases, namely: Climate models [Global Climate Model (GCM) and Canadian Regional Climate Model (CRCM); Reanalysis products; Statistical downscaling input; Observations; and other data. Data available for download are at various temporal resolutions: time series (climate variables at daily, monthly, seasonal or annual scale) and period averages [average values over 3 decades (for the baseline period, and future periods) at monthly, seasonal or annual scale]. All time series and period average climate information are available for the baseline period (i.e. 1961-1990) and the three future periods (i.e. 2011-2040, 2041-2070, and 2071-2100, called 2020s, 2050s, and 2080s, respectively), if the model data is released.

distinfo.resdesc: Canadian Climate Change Scenarios Network (CCCSN). Available online at [http://www.cccsn.ec.gc.ca/index.php] from Environment Canada, Gatineau, Quebec, Canada.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

Data_Set_Link.Label: GCM/RCM Monthly Data
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: The CCCSN allows users to download Global Climate Model (GCM) output from the IS92a, SRES and AR4 (IPCC Fourth Assessment Report) as 20-year, 30-year or user-defined averages, or as time series from 2010 to 2100. The averages and time series are available for both raw variables and extreme indices and can be downloaded as raw output or as anomalies.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Canadian Regional Climate Model (CRCM) Data
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: CRCM data at the monthly, seasonal and annual scale can be downloaded directly from the CCCSN. Higher resolution data can be accessed through the Data Access Interface (DAI). The daily data (time series) are only available to authorized members and partners after the completion of a short registration form. Registration gives users access to DAI.s data support and service.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Reanalysis Data
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: This section will be updated as more data becomes available. Please see the tables on this web page for more information.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Observation Data
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Access daily observed data from meteorological stations and special series of observed daily data from homogenized temperature and adjusted precipitation values.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Other Data for Scenario Construction or Validiation
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Other data for use during scenario construction or validiation can be found in this section. This includes Canadian GEM model data, ENSEMBLES products and data developed through collaborative projects within Environment Canada. This page provides links to: Global Energy Water Cycle Experiment (GEWEX); ENSEMBLES Products; Downscaled Transient High Resolution national climate change scenario data for Canada from 1950-2070 for seven climate variables; Gridded climate data for 1961-90 and scenarios for 2010-39 and 2040-69 periods; Statistical Tool for Extreme Climate Analysis (STECA); and Historical and future climates for the assessment of energy sector impacts in Canada.
